source.5a2a3d6d:
import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt #plotting graphs and chaarts
import seaborn as sns #drawing statistical graphics
%matplotlib inline
gold_data = pd.read_csv('../input/gld_price_data.csv') #reading the data file
gold_data.head()  
gold_data.isna().sum()
import pandas_profiling
source.e9a595ca:
X = gold_data[['SPX','USO','SLV','EUR/USD']]  #mentioning the predictor variables 
y = gold_data['GLD']   # mentioning response variable
#splitting the train and test dataset
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split  
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=101)  #splitting train and test dataset
source.9659db66:
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
lm = LinearRegression()
lm.fit(X_train,y_train)  #training the model with the linear regression function
source.d54c7bbd: lm.coef_  #getting the coefficients after the regression
source.4417bffb:
coeff_df = pd.DataFrame(lm.coef_,X.columns,columns=['Coefficient'])
coeff_df  #coefficients in a matrix form
source.ecf640f6:
predictions = lm.predict(X_test)
plt.scatter(y_test,predictions)
plt.xlabel('Y Test')
plt.ylabel('Predicted Y') #
source.1e602465:
from sklearn import metrics
print('MAE :'," ", metrics.mean_absolute_error(y_test,predictions))
print('MSE :'," ", metrics.mean_squared_error(y_test,predictions))
print('RMAE :'," ", np.sqrt(metrics.mean_squared_error(y_test,predictions)))

source.7dcaa6fa:
# create the plot space upon which to plot the data
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (100,100))

# add the x-axis and the y-axis to the plot
ax.plot(gold_data['Date'], 
        gold_data['GLD'], 
        color = 'red')

# rotate tick labels
plt.setp(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45)

# set title and labels for axes
ax.set(xlabel="Date",
       ylabel="Gold Price",
       title="Gold Price over months")
source.7f1c1b83:
In this report the objective is to predict the price of variable with column name GLD.
Objective: Our objective is to predict the values of the variable GLD with holding the explanatory or predictor variables as SPX, GLD, USO, SLV, USR/USD.

In this report two approaches of understanding of association between the response or predicting variable and the predictors has been done.
•	The first approach is an explicit EDA showing paired correlation and correlation of the predictors with that of the predicting variable.
•	The second approach is performing linear regression applying machine learning algorithms in python, splitting the data set into test and train variables.
Here in this statistical analysis we have used numpy,pandas,matplotlib,seaborn,sklearn for statistical analysis and plotting graphs.
source.795d37f6:
Next we have done linear regression to predict the GLD variable value based on other variables.
We have mentioned the predictor and explanatory variables and split the entire data set into train dataset to train the machine learning model and to apply it on test data set.”train_test_split ” function does the job of splitting the train and test dataset.LinearRegression() function is applied on the train values of the variables. In the fitted model the coefficients come as SPX(0.006584),                                   USO(-0.255845),SLV(3.1477),EUR/USD(-8.9691). Clearly EUR/USD variable has a negative impact on the increase of the values of the variable GLD. SLV has a fairly positive effect.The impact of SPX and USO is merely unmentionable.
Next we have predicted the values of Test data based on the trained algorithm with the function lm.predict and obtained the values of the variable GLD as “predictions”.Next we have compared both the predicted values iven values of test in a scatterplot.
The scatterplot clearly shows that the deviation between the given values or observed values of GLD and predicted values of GLD (here named as “predictions”) being maximum at the large values of the variable GLD.
source.a65671f9:
The correlation between the predictors and the response variable is calculated and scatterplots have been plotted accordingly.
•	The correlation between the variable GLD and SLV is positive and near to 1.That means GLD and SLV are highly correlated with a high degree of association.
•	The correlation between the variable GLD and EUR/USD is nearly zero.That means GLD and EUR/USD has no such association.
•	The correlation between the variable GLD and USO is negative and near to 0.That means GLD and USO are slightly correlated with a very low degree of association.
•	The correlation between the variable GLD and SPX is nearly zero.That means GLD and SPX are not correlated or does not have any such association.
A heatmap and pairplot has been created among the variables to understand the relations between the variables better.
source.5a2845f0:
The errors for this regression fitting comes along as 
MAE :   5.938773207131296  (Mean absolute error)
MSE :   63.54693696387926  (Mean Square Error)  (explains the deviation)
RMAE :   7.971633268275659 (Root Mean Square Error)
